meanings.definition: Give (someone) greater knowledge and understanding about a subject or situation.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will enlighten the students about the solar system.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to enlighten her friends with interesting facts.
meanings.sent3: The wise owl decided to enlighten the young squirrel about the importance of saving acorns.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a beacon, ready to enlighten those lost in the darkness of ignorance.
meanings.sent5: The documentary aimed to enlighten viewers about the impact of climate change.

meanings.definition: Make (something) clearer and easier to understand.
meanings.sent1: Using visuals can help enlighten complex concepts for students.
meanings.sent2: The professor used simple analogies to enlighten the difficult topic.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was meant to enlighten the audience but ended up confusing them more.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to enlighten the room, making everything clearer and brighter.
meanings.sent5: The map was designed to enlighten travelers on the best routes to take.
